section.title: Usage information
section.p: The following list outlines common uses of the desc element:

dlentry.dd: Provides more information than can be contained in the title.

dd.p: Provides a description of the target.

dlentry.dd: Provides alternate content to use when the context does not permit displaying the object.

section.title: Processing expectations
section.p: When used in conjunction with fig or table, processors SHOULD consider a description to be part of the content flow.
When used in conjunction with xref or link elements, processors MAY choose to render the content of a desc element as hover help.

fig.title: Description of a figure
fig.p: In the following code sample, the figure contains an image of a famous painting by Leonardo Da Vinci. The title provides the name of the painting, while the desc element contains information about when the portrait is thought to have been painted.
fig.codeblock: <fig> <title>Mona Lisa</title> <desc>Circa 1503â€“06, perhaps continuing until 1517</desc> <image href="mona-lisa.jpg"> <alt>Photograph of Mona Lisa painting</alt> </image> </fig>

fig.title: Description of a cross reference
fig.p: In the following code sample, a desc element is used within a link. Some processors might use the content of the desc element as hover help.
fig.codeblock: <link keyref="dita-13-02"> <linktext>DITA 1.3 Errata 02</linktext> <desc>Final errata version of DITA 1.3, published 19 June 2018</desc> </link>
